name: Greek Turkey Burgers
description: Take your burger game next level with the Greek salad-topped burger. All those juicy Mediterranean flavours and fresh veg. The variety of veggies in the salad delivers a buffet of health benefits. Antioxidant-rich ingredients like tomatoes and peppers help protect cells from damage and inflammation.

ingredients.name: Chicken Souvlaki Seasoning or Donair Seasoning

preparation: In a large bowl, mix turkey and seasoning. Form into four equal burger patties.
Heat oil in Sauté Pan over medium heat. Add patties and cook for 4–5 min per side, or until cooked through.

Meanwhile, chop the tomato, shallot, bell pepper, and cucumber into large chunks and place in a food processor. Pulse the vegetables a few times until they are combined and cut into smaller chunks.  Be careful not to blend too much—you still want some chunks in your salsa.

Split buns and toast, if desired. Spread buns with mayo and place lettuce on bottom buns. Divide burgers, salsa, feta, and additional toppings (if using) between bottom buns. Add top bun to each fully dressed bottom bun.
tips: Swap out seasoning for 2-3 tbsp Greek Dressing Mix
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: This is a perfectly balanced meal.

products.name: Chicken Souvlaki Seasoning (Pkg of 3)
summary: A Greek-inspired meal, souvlaki is marinated meat grilled on a skewer, often served with warm pita bread and tzatziki. No grill? No problem. Skip the skewers and put your Sheet Pan to work to make equally tasty Chicken Souvlaki in 20 minutes in the oven.

products.name: Donair Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: Any way you name it – gyro, shawarma, donair, or doner kebab – our Donair Seasoning is what you’re looking for. You won’t believe how easy it is to make the street food staple at home in minutes with this blend and a few simple ingredients. Just add the seasoning to ground beef, press it into a Rectangular Steamer and cook it in the microwave for 10 minutes or the oven for 60. Slice thinly and serve on a pita with fresh veggies and tzatziki – dinner is done!

products.name: Greek Dressing Mix
summary: Herbs make salad dressings taste great, but they can be a pain to buy and use while fresh. Enter our Greek Dressing to solve the problem. Packed with only good food ingredients, including garlic, oregano, mint, and zero additives, it’s easy to make your own healthy dressing with this simple blend. Just mix it with olive oil and red wine vinegar and give it a shake. Add crumbled feta or Greek yogurt for a creamier dressing.

products.name: Sauté Pan
summary: An all-purpose pan to brown, sauté, and simmer—ideal for one pan meals.
